metadata.Title: CVE-2020-29509 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description: The encoding/xml package in Go (all versions) does not correctly preserve the semantics of attribute namespace prefixes during tokenization round-trips, which allows an attacker to craft inputs that behave in conflicting ways during different stages of processing in affected downstream applications.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Packages built using golang need to be rebuilt once the vulnerability has been fixed. This CVE entry does not list packages that need rebuilding outside of the main repository or the Ubuntu variants with PPA overlays.  as of 2021-08-10, there likely won't be a fix for this issue by the upstream go developers

criterions.comment: golang-1.13 package in impish is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
golang-1.15 package in impish is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
